item.title: Maxfield add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I lost the conviction that lights would always turn green for me, the pleasant certainty that those rather passive virtues which had won me approval as a child automatically guaranteed me not only Phi Beta Kappa keys but happiness, honor, and the love of a good man; lost a certain touching faith in the totem power of good manners, clean hair, and a proven competence on the Stanford-Binet scale. To such doubtful amulets had my self-respect been pinned, and I faced myself that day with the non-plused apprehension of someone who has come across a vampire and has no crucifix at hand." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Maxfield add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Teach us to care and not to care" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Maxfield add a quote by Rickie Lee Jones
item.description: "You never know when you're making a memory" -- Rickie Lee Jones

item.title: Maxfield add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper." -- Francis Bacon
